conclusion: Determine the velocity v1 of the negatively charged particles when they reach the collection device on the positive x-axis using principles of circular motion in a magnetic field and geometry.
The radius r of the circular path can be found using the formula r = mv/qB.
The particle source S is located at a distance d = 1.2 m above the origin O, and particles are emitted in all directions within the first quadrant.
The total distance from S to the collection device is 2r, and using the Pythagorean theorem: (2r)^2 = d^2 + r^2.
Simplifying the equation gives r = d/sqrt(3).
Substitute d = 1.2 m to find r = 0.693 m.
Calculate the velocity v1 using the formula v1 = qBr/m.
Substitute q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg, B = 5 x 10^-3 T, and r = 0.693 m to find v1 = 6.93 x 10^3 m/s.
The velocity v1 of the particles when they reach the collection device is approximately 6.93 x 10^3 m/s.
